page.title: 15WERRINGTON CRICKET CLUB.
page.content: Cricket was first recorded at Werrington as early as 1859,when an all England X1 played 22 of the best locals at the Park.The game was played in a field adjoining Church Rd.After the First World War Com. A.M.Williams erected a fence around approx.4 acres of land which is now W.C.C.'s home.The captain then was S.Soper with regular players Messrs.Gotto,Bristow,Sobey, H.& E.Baker,Anstey,Mann,Daniels,Furse, Warne & Balsdon.The club prospered for many years until World War 2 with Messrs.Baker,Horrell,Ellacott,Martyn and Cobbledick doing well with bat and ball. In 1941,with approx.14 playing members including the Furse brothers Eric, Stan.,Ron.and Terry,the Club went from strength to strength.
